subject: Re: [junit] Passing command line arguments
msgSnippet: ... Perhaps a PropertyManager utility class would carry its own weight.  It might provide query methods that return the read-only value for a property using
messageBody:
Shay Hassidim wrote:

>Hi,
>
>
>
>I would like to pass command line arguments to JUnit test.
>
>I have seen a suggestion to use s static String array to store command line
>arguments , but I do not like this idea which force me to have relevant
>functionality at each test I have to do that and in addition I do not like
>the idea having static variable since I would have same tests running in
>different threads using different parameters.
>
>

Perhaps a PropertyManager utility class would carry its own weight. It
might provide query methods that return the read-only value for a
property using System.getProperty() under the hood.

Mike
